description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2magt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei9kc","text":"This protocol is designed for extracting total nucleic acids (TNA) from plant material. In reality the drying step probably means that you won't isolate plant mRNA but viral RNA (and probably plant ribosomal RNA) are recovered. This protocol is based on the plant tissue TNA extraction method from bomb.bio but modified to use inexpensive 96 well spin column plates. The reasons for this are three-fold:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":298,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"avu53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei8r1","text":"SPRI bead protocols are complicated to perform for multiple plates simultaneously. Using this protocol, up to four plates of extractions can be performed simultaneously in a deep well plate centrifuge such as the Heraeus Megafuge 40R. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42i77","text":"SPRI beads require very clean supernatant after grinding to prevent plant particles binding within the bead pellet and causing downstream contamination whereas the spin columns and filter plates mechanically filter the lysate.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djp1i","text":"Spin columns allow a larger amount of input material than the bomb.bio protocol.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1i5j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73hnp","text":"This protocol is significantly improved through the use of high volume multichannel electronic repeaters (e.g. a Gilson PIPETMAN M P8X1200M) or a 96 well pipette (e.g. the Gilson Platemaster) but can be performed using manual multichannel pipettes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":113,"length":26},{"key":2,"offset":172,"length":18}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FB6B5F60790811EC8209B1D3A76E3E73","url":"https://bomb.bio/protocols/"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C3A929C0790A11EC8209B1D3A76E3E73","url":"https://gb.gilson.com/GBSV/pipetman-m-p8x1200m-bt-connected.html"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FBF00DD0790A11EC8209B1D3A76E3E73","url":"https://gb.gilson.com/GBSV/platemaster-220ul.html"}}}}

forks.title: Spin column TNA extraction from plants - CTAB method

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"baaq2","text":"Note on centrifugation in this protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmugn","text":"Maximum x g throughout is determined by both the centrifuge and the tolerances of the plastic labware you are using. If you find that not all of the liquid is moving through the spin column or that debris pellets are not pelleting, you can increase centrifugation times without any detriment to the process. Similarly, if you find plastic labware is breaking during centrifugation (this can happen with certain 0.5 ml deepwell plates), reduce the speed/g of the centrifuge and increase the centrifugation time to compensate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99cq1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ogta","text":"Note on blocked spin columns:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6slgb","text":"Large samples and gelatinous samples can occasionally block the spin column. This can be dealt with by:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vrvo","text":"Increasing centrifuge times.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36mg6","text":"Decreasing input material.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56n5","text":"Increasing the centrifugation time in the debris pelleting stage.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gdds","text":"Place tubes while still cold in tissue homogeniser and grind the plant material in a tissue homogeniser until homogenised.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8s3g8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n9do","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4dnas","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":187,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"4mvpn","text":"We use a Geno/Grinder 2010 at full speed (1750 RPM) for 1-2 minutes in 1 min batches but different machines or even tube sizes and sample volumes will require separate optimised settings.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"862cf","text":"Leave for 5 min then centrifuge at maximum speed for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mg5l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"dau80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":76,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"61nds","text":"If the centrifuge cannot reach ~6000 x g, a longer centrifugation will work.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cca1f","text":"Add 400 μL Isopropanol to each spin column, cover with a breathable seal and leave for two minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5gaia","text":"Centrifuge at maximum speed for 5 minutes and discard the flow-through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17enk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73v5g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"613p8","text":"Wash spin columns three times as in substeps below with 80% Ethanol solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33i2","text":"Add 300 μL of 80% Ethanol solution to each well and centrifuge at maximum speed for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b74br","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7j0kh","text":"Centrifuge spin columns for two further minutes at full speed to remove any last traces of ethanol from the silica membranes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b7m1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c8gjs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":28,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":28,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"4ilu8","text":"Note on waste plate handling","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":212,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":32,"offset":214,"style":"italic"}],"key":"bg8qu","text":"At this point, your waste plate below the spin column will contain ~1720 μL of waste and will be close to the bottom of the spin column tips. Be extremely careful when handling plates to ensure that spin columns do not come in contact with waste.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4iog","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":260,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"76du1","text":"This can be helped by having two waste plates for each spin column plate (i.e. you will need four 2.2ml plates if processing two spin column plates at a time and eight if processing four at a time). Simply change waste plates after the second wash buffer wash.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18cd0","text":"Carefully move the spin column plate to a new 0.5 mL DNA collection plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"pv30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9drma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22r6a","text":"Add 100 μL Elution Buffer or nuclease free water directly to the silica membrane and leave it at room temperature for 5 minutes, covering with a breathable seal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cgf","text":"Elution Buffer should be pH ~7 and comprised of the following reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2079i","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"djpbb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c9tcd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"},"C_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-center"},"D_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_3":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_4":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"D_5":{"className":"_dt-h-center"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Required concentration in buffer","Chemical molarity","Amount per 100 mL"],["1 M Tris-Hcl","10 mM","-","1 mL"],["H2O","-","-","99 mL"]],"guid":"4D198D278DB611ECA1850A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["Reagent","Required concentration in buffer","Chemical molarity","Amount per 100 mL"],["1 M Tris-Hcl","10 mM","-","1 mL"],["H2O","-","-","99 mL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3raif","text":"Centrifuge at ≥ 6000 x g for 2 minutes. The DNA is now in the collection plate and can be taken forward to amplification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9fdb1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6rn02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":88,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"3picl","text":"Steps 26 - 27 can be repeated for increased DNA yield but a lower overall concentration.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c56ik","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":141,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"bk964","text":"If the centrifuge cannot reach 6000 x g, a longer centrifugation (e.g., 5 minutes) will work, although should not be necessary for this step.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
